output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of advanced inorganic chemistry principles, preparing students for research and advanced studies in the field.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Inorganic Chemistry! This course delves into the intricacies of inorganic compounds, bonding theories, and their applications. We will explore advanced concepts and current research in the field.

chapters.description: Introduction to symmetry operations and point groups. Application of group theory to molecular vibrations and electronic structure.
Understanding character tables and their use in determining selection rules and predicting molecular properties.

chapters.chapterTitle: Molecular Orbital Theory for Coordination Complexes
chapters.description: Advanced MO diagrams for octahedral, tetrahedral, and square planar complexes. Ligand field theory revisited.
Detailed analysis of the spectrochemical series and its impact on electronic transitions. Tanabe-Sugano diagrams.
Introduction to organometallic ligands and their bonding modes. 18-electron rule and its exceptions.
Homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis using organometallic complexes. Examples include hydrogenation, polymerization, and C-C coupling reactions.
Crystal structures, packing arrangements, and defects in solids. Band theory and electronic properties of solids.
Types of magnetism in solids (ferromagnetism, antiferromagnetism, ferrimagnetism). Introduction to superconductivity and high-temperature superconductors.

chapters.chapterTitle: Bioinorganic Chemistry: Metal Ions in Biological Systems
chapters.description: Role of metal ions in enzymes and proteins. Oxygen transport, electron transfer, and metal-based drugs.
Inorganic pollutants and their impact on the environment. Remediation strategies and green chemistry approaches.
